definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: Moreover, its breaking strength is reduced but the breaking extension improved.
sentences.chinese: 棉織物的斷裂強度降低，斷裂延伸度提高。

sentences.english: The difficulties of fracture strength of MEMS thin film lie in test and how loads are applied.
sentences.chinese: MEMS薄膜斷裂強度測試難點在於負載和測試。

sentences.english: Broken strength of arms and tentacula of squid is a significant factor affecting the jigging-off rate.
sentences.chinese: 魷魚的腕足斷裂強度是影響魷釣脫鉤率的重要因素。

sentences.english: In this paper, the influence of the surface residual stresses of ceramics grinding on fracture strength has been studied.
sentences.chinese: 探討了陶瓷磨削表面殘餘應力對斷裂強度的影響。

sentences.english: Heat shrink temperature and breaking strength tests were carried out.
sentences.chinese: 分組測定熱皺縮溫度及斷裂強度。

sentences.english: The results suggest that the stress is close to the breaking strength.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明，螺栓的預緊應力接近材料的斷裂強度。
